blocks.content: Loops are a way to iterate multiple times through a set of Steps or Inputs. Loops can “embed” any of the step types exiting in the system, marking it highly powerful.

points.text: Select the Loop Step icon:
Choose where you want to put the Loop Step in the orange bar below
Add Loop text to the input field
Add different Input elements into the Loop Step to loop over
Validate the Step by clicking the green tick:

blocks.caption:
Loops on the web
Step 3 is a loop to collect two pieces of information, a location and cable run. In this example, users where required to iterate through various on-site locations. Once done with the first location, a user would enter values for the next location by tapping on “Create Next Iteration”. Loops can have a fixed number of iterations or can be infinite.

Loops on mobile devices
The UI on the mobile devices is very similar to that of the web. In addition, however, the current number of iterations is displayed in a badge next to each input inside the loop.

blocks.content: For infinite loops, marking a loop as done will stop the loop from continuing to add iterations after answering the inputs in each current iteration.
